quiz.title: Basic Inequality Solving
quiz.subtitle: Unit 6 Quiz 3: Solving One-Step Inequalities
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Solving Inequalities with Single Operations - Focus on Negative Coefficients

questions.question: Solve: $-m > 5$
questions.explanation: Divide both sides by -1: $\frac{-m}{-1} < \frac{5}{-1}$, so $m < -5$. MUST flip inequality when dividing by negative.

questions.question: Solve: $-4n < -20$
questions.explanation: Divide both sides by -4: $\frac{-4n}{-4} > \frac{-20}{-4}$, so $n > 5$. Flip inequality when dividing by negative.

questions.question: Solve: $x + 7 > 12$
questions.explanation: Subtract 7 from both sides: $x > 5$. No flip when adding/subtracting.

questions.question: Solve: $3z ≥ 21$
questions.explanation: Divide by 3: $z ≥ 7$. No flip when dividing by positive.

questions.question: Solve: $-2x > 10$
questions.explanation: Divide by -2: $x < -5$. Flip when dividing by negative.

questions.question: Solve: $\frac{w}{-4} ≤ 3$
questions.explanation: Multiply by -4: $w ≥ -12$. Flip when multiplying by negative.

questions.question: Solve: $-0.5y < 8$
questions.explanation: Divide by -0.5: $y > -16$. Flip when dividing by negative.

questions.question: Solve: $-\frac{k}{3} ≥ 6$
questions.explanation: Multiply by -3: $k ≤ -18$. Flip when multiplying by negative.

questions.question: Solve: $5 > -t$
questions.explanation: Rewrite as $-t < 5$. Multiply by -1: $t > -5$. Flip when multiplying by negative.

questions.question: Solve: $-7p ≤ 49$
questions.explanation: Divide by -7: $p ≥ -7$. Flip when dividing by negative.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You've mastered the critical rule: FLIP THE INEQUALITY when multiplying/dividing by negatives. This is the most common error in inequality solving!
scoreMessages.70: Strong skills! The key is remembering to flip with negatives. Watch for: $-x$, $\frac{x}{-a}$, or negative coefficients.
scoreMessages.50: Good progress. Focus on: 1) Identifying negative coefficients, 2) ALWAYS flipping when multiplying/dividing by negatives, 3) No flip with addition/subtraction.
scoreMessages.0: Critical rule: When you multiply or divide both sides of an inequality by a NEGATIVE number, you MUST FLIP the inequality sign (> becomes <, ≥ becomes ≤).
